name: Sofitel Vienna Stephansdom

reviews.text: For those who don't know us, let's just say we are definitely NOT the easiest of guests to please.
reviews.title: Simply an AMAZING city hotel

reviews.text: Well..., this is one of those cherished & extremely rare occasions we were definitely pleased and have nothing, ABSOLUTELY NOTHING negative to say.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.text: From the moment you approach the entrance, you are taken aback by the collective efforts of every single person working there to make you feel welcome, make your check-in process smooth & quick and allow you to make the most out of your visit to Vienna.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.text: The bellmen, concierge, reception staff, housekeeping, everyone was totally professional and extremely efficient at what they did.
reviews.title: Great staff, cool design, practical features - but pricey

reviews.text: The room..., it is very difficult to describe the room accurately. Let's just say it is easily among the top 2 - 3 hotel rooms we have ever seen & stayed in anywhere in the world!
reviews.title: Might be big and 'cool' but still the personal touch
Excellent
reviews.text: Excellent hotel for our conference. Surprising mix of clean nearly stark architecture in the rooms and conference facilities and two brilliantly coloured floors - one of them the 18th floor restaurant which offers a panoramic view of Vienna. Food is no better than OK. In breakfast buffet it would be good to have some hot food.
We spent 4 nights at this ultra modern hotel in an all white junior suite on the 17th floor
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views of the city from our room and the restaurant on the floor above were spectacular
reviews.title: The Black Suite

reviews.text: The staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them
reviews.title: Great place, great building, great location
Service is very slow
reviews.text: In particular we would mention Wolfgang Wagner the concierge for his great help prior to and during our stay
You either like sleek modern or you don't. If you do (or if you don't mind either way but value tremendous service and excellent accommodation) then stay here. It's brilliant.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Unfortunately I only had one night. As a A-Club gold card holder I was upgraded to a luxury room on the 13th floor with a great view of the city. All in grey, the room looked wonderful and I had a perfect night's sleep (as ever in Sofitel beds).
reviews.title: Sofitel. It is the service that’s makes this hotel stand out from the rest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is exemplary - a real feature of Sofitels overall - at reception (about the best I've experienced), bar, breakfast, lobby, everything. Breakfast was very good and unlike some previous reviewers, I had no problem getting a table with a view at 08.30.
reviews.title: what a miracle

reviews.text: The location is very good too. You're close to just about everything (but then Vienna isn't too big, the Innere Stadt anyway).
reviews.title: perfect vieuw, great staff....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel Vienna attempts to position itself as a top-notch modern luxury hotel and in these aspects it largely succeeds. The clean white artistic modern rooms are beautiful and inspiring, so much so that we spent the first half hour of our stay just admiring the design and furnishings. The beds are extremely comfortable, the staff is very polite and helpful, and the hotel is quite conveniently located – on a subway line and within walking distance of the city centre. Overall, the hotel (and our room) was one that left us happy to come back to it every night and refreshed as we woke up each morning (we particularly appreciated how the all white rooms on the high floor created the illusion of having slept on a cloud).
reviews.title: An excellent hotel, but you expect more...
Loved it!!!
reviews.text: However, despite its undisputed quality and comfort, given the rates charged and the hotel class, there were several things that left us a little disappointed. Not that there is anything critically wrong with the hotel, but given its calibre, we held it to a higher standard than other hotels, and it was in these little details that we expected more.

One example is room service. While everything was generally cleaned as expected, and the toiletries were immaculately restocked and reorganized each morning, we found it very odd that any cup in our room with any amount of tea or coffee remaining inside was left untouched and uncleaned. Why would anyone think that we would want to come back to the leftovers of a cold tea we brewed the night before? This little oversight (on two separate days) left us frustrated as we would lack clean cups after returning to our room in the evening.
reviews.title: O.k. service, but definitely not 5 star hotel.

reviews.text: We were similarly frustrated with the extremely poor quality of the toilet paper: stiff, rough, and irritatingly unpleasant. It is really unfortunate (and surprising) that a hotel of such high quality would use such a poor quality product.
reviews.title: Ultra Modern, Fantastic View form 18th floor restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was also quite underwhelming. For the (almost embarrassingly high) price charged, we really expected something inspired and memorable - something artisan or a-la-carte that we haven’t seen elsewhere - but this was essentially just a typical hotel buffet setup with a few warm dishes (mainly eggs) that could be ordered on demand. Good, solid, generally fresh - but nothing out of the ordinary and definitely disappointing for the price charged and the quality of the hotel serving it.
reviews.title: modern elegance

description: Within splendid view of it's gothic namesake, St. Stephens Cathedral, the 5 star superior Sofitel Vienna Stephansdom is an emphatically 21st century structure. Echoing the hotel's sleek exteriors, the 182 monochromatic guest rooms, including 26 suites, are decorated in either immaculate white, cool grey or velvety black. On the mezzanine level the hotel offers a business center and a library. For distinctive business or celebratory events you can choose from 9 sun lit meeting rooms for up to 130 people. On the 5th floor guests can enjoy a relaxing massage in our So SPA or work out in our So FIT. Crowning the Sofitel Vienna Stephansdom, is it's ultimate feature, the 18th floor walled in only by glass Le LOFT Restaurant, Bar & Lounge, which has been recently awarded by Gault Millau. Serving French and Austrian cuisine, chef Raphael Dworak will pamper your palate, while you will be amazed by the beauty of Vienna in 75 meters height.
